title: Former Bachelor’s vegan condom venture
text:
Use keywords to search content on this website Search Use keywords to search content on this website media_camera Former Cleo Bachelor hottie Dustin Leonard runs a condom charity and has released a vegan-friendly range. Picture: Supplied Former Bachelor of the Year’s vegan condoms and lube have animal lovers hot under the collar Shannon Molloy, News Corp Australia February 14, 2017 11:52am 
WHO knew many condoms and lubricants contained animal byproducts? 
Dustin Leonard, a former Cleo Bachelor of the Year finalist and social entrepreneur , has launched a range of vegan sexual health aids to plug a surprising gap in the market. 
And the response so far has been hot and heavy, he said. 
“A vegan condom doesn’t contain any animal products or byproducts and hasn’t had any of the components tested on animals,” Leonard explained. 
“Some lubricants are also packed with parabens and other unfriendly ingredients. Parabens are commonly used in cosmetics as preservatives to prevent bacterial overgrowth but can interfere with our normal rhythmical, hormonal process by binding to the same cell receptors as estrogen.” media_camera Dustin Leonard is the CEO of socially geared company Hero Condoms. Picture: Supplied 
His range is plant-based, pH balanced and petrochemical and paraben free. 
“They’re also flared at the end for better fit and comfort and our ultra thin condom is basically as thin as it can be and still pass international manufacturing standards. 
“To our knowledge we are the only vegan sexual health brand for sale in major retailers across Australia.” 
His company HERO is a social enterprise that works on a one-for-one basis — for every sexual health product sold here, one is sent to Africa. media_camera Dustin Leonard used his Cleo Bachelor of the Year nomination in 2015 to raise awareness of sexual health initiatives in Africa. Picture: Supplied 
Since its launch , more than half a million free condoms have been sent to the HIV/AIDS-ravaged continent. 
He’s faced stiff competition from multi-billion dollar rivals to secure lucrative distribution deals with Coles and Woolworths . 
Leonard is now in discussions with major retailers in the United Kingdom and China, with plans to launch in those markets later this year. 
It’s not just his social enterprise that’s booming — the American expat’s love life is also in good shape, he reveals. media_camera Since his Bachelor of the year experience, Dustin has found love with aspiring actress and model Ravare. Picture: Supplied 
Following his Cleo Bachelor experience in 2015 , Leonard joined Tiner and matched with Ravare, an aspiring actress and musician. 
“I used my Cleo picture on my Tinder profile and it landed me the most amazing girl in the world,” he beamed. 
“We’ve been dating for almost a year and I couldn’t be happier.”
